thread.title: Sweden’s official tweeter is devoting his time to fact-checking President Trump - Salon.com
thread.title_full: Sweden’s official tweeter is devoting his time to fact-checking President Trump - Salon.com

author: Rachel Leah
title: Sweden’s official tweeter is devoting his time to fact-checking President Trump - Salon.com
text:
Tuesday, Feb 21, 2017 5:54 PM UTC Sweden’s official tweeter is devoting his time to fact-checking President Trump The citizen-run Twitter account @sweden, debunked Trump's claims about crime and immigration in Sweden. Topics: Donald Trump , Sweden , Twitter , Media News , News (Credit: AP) 
In 2011, Curators of Sweden — a project administered through the Nordic country’s cultural institutions — had an idea. Each week, a different Twitter user would take over the country’s Twitter handle, @sweden, to show off the country’s multiplicity to the world. The rules are simple: You need an active Twitter account and, to either be a resident of Sweden or have Swedish citizenship abroad. Hate speech and promoting one’s personal brand are frowned upon. 
But 22-year old Max Karlsson, the self-professed “nerd” and “fire starter” who’s running the country’s social media account can’t stop talking about President Donald Trump . 
It started with Trump’s comments Saturday about “what’s happening last night in Sweden,” but continued when the president doubled down on his claims about the Swedish crime rate. 

When Karlsson took over @sweden Monday, he wasted no time dispelling Trump’s alternative facts. We have around 100 murders per year. Thats like two days in the US. Two. Days. 
— @sweden / Max (@sweden) February 20, 2017 
During the time Sweden received 250.000 refugees, unemployment has fallen with 1,2%-points. https://t.co/aZkMfoeOUc — @sweden / Max (@sweden) February 20, 2017 Hey Don, this is @Sweden speaking! It’s nice of you to care, really, but don’t fall for the hype. Facts: We’re ok! https://t.co/Vux6IjzOjO https://t.co/rEmO83DN1B 
— @sweden / Max (@sweden) February 20, 2017 
. @realDonaldTrump & co now suggests immigration in Sweden has directly led to increase in crime. Fact check: https://t.co/IIIQAkWp4J — @sweden / Max (@sweden) February 21, 2017
